articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz accepts the Democratic nomination for vice president on Wednesday with 11 weeks to go before he and presidential running mate Kamala Harris face Republican former President Donald Trump in the 2024 U.S. election.
articles.title: DNC on Wednesday: Minnesota's Walz, Pelosi, Bill Clinton

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli airstrikes across Gaza killed at least 50 Palestinians in the past 24 hours, Palestinian health authorities said on Wednesday, as the military said troops continued to target militants and seize weapons and ammunition.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill dozens in Gaza after Blinken ends visit with truce deal still elusive

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine launched a widespread drone attack on Russia on Wednesday, with air defence units destroying three drones some 38 kms (24 miles) south of the Kremlin, and 15 over the border Bryansk region, Russian officials said.
articles.title: Ukraine launches drone attack on Moscow, other regions, Russian officials say

articles.author: Farah Master, Laurie Chen
articles.description: Mary Meng is so busy and stressed working for a Chinese tech company in Shanghai that she can't imagine having a second child.
articles.title: China's fresh urbanisation push may thwart 'birth-friendly society' goal

articles.author: Giselda Vagnoni
articles.description: The yacht was lying sideways at a depth of around 50 meters, giving divers up to 10 minutes to inspect it before having to resurface.
articles.title: Four bodies retrieved from Mike Lynch's sunken yacht in Sicily

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States Navy said on Thursday the destroyer USS Ralph Johnson made a routine Taiwan Strait transit on Aug. 22 in accordance with international law, a statement said.
articles.title: USS Ralph Johnson made routine Taiwan Strait transit, says US Navy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 11 people were killed in an Israeli strike on a residential building in the northern Gaza town of Beit Lahiya in the early hours of Thursday, official Palestinian news agency Wafa said.
articles.title: Eleven killed in Israeli strike on Gaza's Beit Lahiya, Palestinian news agency says

articles.author: Ricardo Brito
articles.description: Brazil will tighten up rules to enter the country without a visa starting next week, the government said on Wednesday, after migrants have been increasingly using the South American nation as a stop-over on the way to the United States and Canada.
articles.title: Brazil to tighten entry rules to curb migration to North America

articles.author: Rishika Sadam
articles.description: The death toll in an explosion at a pharmaceuticals manufacturing plant in India's southern state of Andhra Pradesh rose to 17 on Thursday, Industries Secretary N. Yuvaraj, a senior official, told Reuters.
articles.title: Death toll in India's Andhra Pradesh pharma factory blast rises to 17

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia will take steps to respond after Latvia made it harder for Russian citizens to extend residence permits, foreign ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova told the RIA news agency on Thursday.
articles.title: Russia to retaliate on Latvia's residence permit move, official tells RIA
